name: LiterallyCSS
tagline: lazy styling, why just don't call it, literally.
body:
# literallycss stylesheet for easier/verbose and meaning full styling for anyone does not like to create a lot of repeating a same css property and values. Or you just don't want to create a lot of css rules. Just include a class name and it will implement as a css rules named. For example, you want a image full width of the container (suppose `
`) you can do like this `` :feelsgood: :+1: # THIS PAGE IS STILL UNDERDEVELOPMENT
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
